contextId.occurrenceNote: In this culture, tearing one's own clothes and putting dirt on one's head was an act of mourning. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: with his clothes torn and with dirt on his head

contextId.occurrenceNote: This was an act of showing submission to David, who was now the king of Israel. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: he lay facedown on the ground and prostrated himself

contextId.occurrenceNote: David and his men tore their clothes as a sign of mourning for the death of King Saul. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: David tore his clothes ... the men with him did the same

contextId.occurrenceNote: In this symbolic act, they poured oil on David's head to show that he was selected to be the king. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: anointed David king

contextId.occurrenceNote: In this symbolic act, they poured oil on David's head to show that he was selected to be the king. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: anointed me king

contextId.occurrenceNote: These were symbolic actions to demonstrate their grief and sadness. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: Tear your clothes, put on sackcloth

contextId.occurrenceNote: These were symbolic actions to show contempt for the men. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: cut off their hands and feet and hung them up

contextId.occurrenceNote: This was a symbolic act to honor Ishbosheth. This could be stated explicitly. Alternate translation: "they honored Ishbosheth by burying his head in the grave" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: they took the head of Ishbosheth and buried it in the grave

contextId.occurrenceNote: To "anoint" is a symbolic act to show that they recognized that God had chosen David as king. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: They anointed David king over Israel

contextId.occurrenceNote: These are acts of mourning and grief in the Israelite culture. Alternate translation: "put ashes on her head and tore her robe to show that she was very sad. Then to show her grief, she put her hands on her head" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: put ashes on her head and tore her robe. She put her hands on her head

contextId.occurrenceNote: He did these things to show that he was extremely sad. Alternate translation: "tore his clothes, and threw himself on the floor grieving" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: tore his clothes, and lay on the floor

contextId.occurrenceNote: They did this to show their sadness and to mourn with their king. Alternate translation: "and tore their clothes, mourning with the king" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: with their clothes torn

contextId.occurrenceNote: She did this to show her respect and submission to the king. Alternate translation: "she showed her respect to the king by laying facedown on the ground" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: she lay facedown on the ground

contextId.occurrenceNote: Joab did this to honor the king and show his gratitude. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: Joab lay facedown on the ground

contextId.occurrenceNote: Absalom is showing respect to the king. Alternate translation: "bowed low to the ground to honor the king" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: bowed low to the ground before the king

contextId.occurrenceNote: These men would run in front of the chariot to honor Absalom. Alternate translation: "with fifty men to run before him to honor him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: with fifty men to run before him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This action is a friendly greeting. Alternate translation: "greet him as a friend by embracing him and kissing him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: put out his hand and take hold of him and kiss him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is a sign of mourning and shame. Alternate translation: "his head covered in mourning" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: his head covered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an act showing shame or repentance. Here the word "earth" means dirt. Alternate translation: "He had torn his clothes and put dirt on his head to show that he was very sad" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: with his coat torn and earth on his head

contextId.occurrenceNote: He did this to honor the king. Alternate translation: "He bowed himself before the king with his face to the ground to honor the king" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: He bowed himself before the king with his face to the ground

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is a way to express grief and mourning. Alternate translation: "The king showed his grief by covering his face" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: The king covered his face

contextId.occurrenceNote: Anointing was done by pouring oil on a person's head. This was done to choose who would serve God as king or priest. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: anointed by the God of Jacob

contextId.occurrenceNote: He was showing deep respect and honor to the king. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: bowed to the king with his face to the ground
